TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1348
TEI.2.document_title: S. A. Anderson to Stephen F. Austin, 05-28-1826

barker_notes.barker_summary: S. A. Anderson to Austin, May 28, 1826 Payments for land. Indians.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1348

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*S. A. Anderson to Austin, May 28, 1826 Payments for land. Indians.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Colorado*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="05-28-1826">May 28th 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Coln Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*sir*/p*
*p*Since I arrived heare I have not had an opportunity of going over to see you respecting the payment of my *location_mentioned*land */location_mentioned*and we consider our force so week that many of us cant leave the fort at a time but as soon as I can I will be over to see you,—I have made arrangements in *location_mentioned*Allexandria */location_mentioned*for the payment of my note by Draught if you think proper if not I will send on immediately after the money that is as soon as times will permit but I had rather had an indulgence till the ishue of the war as; if I cant go home this *date_mentioned n="Fall - 1826">faull */date_mentioned*I wish to return to *location_mentioned*the states*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. A. Anderson*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*N. B. I send you by *person_mentioned*Mr. George Duty*/person_mentioned* a Bill for thirty Dollars in land or trade please to give me a credit on my Note for what it calls for in cash etc., etc*/p*
______ *p**person_mentioned*S. A. A*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
